intro: Coreopsis insecta, commonly known as the narrowleaf coreopsis, is a flowering plant native to the central and eastern United States. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of 1 to 3 feet, featuring hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces bright yellow to orange flowers in clusters, which bloom from late spring to early summer. Its flowers are composed of ray florets and disk florets, typical of the Asteraceae family. Coreopsis insecta is known for its drought tolerance and ability to thrive in full sun, making it a popular choice for native gardens.
